page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: ECOLOGY. The farms are small and grouped around the hamlets. The small fields with hedgerows, or dry stone walling, the hedges being mainly high, but well kept, of blackberry, hawthorne and elder, with natural grass land for grazing. ANIMAL FARMING. In the lowland area there is mainly dairy farming, on the high ground large flocks of sheep graze freely, being brought down to the lower ground in winter, and there is a large piggery on one of the farms in the Rhiwbebyll. CROPS. There is some cereal farming, oats, wheat and barley as well as hay, silage, kale and swedes.
